snippet: Tony Gilroy helped save Range Rover by realizing there was an affluent segment at the top of the new S.U.V. market that would respond to upper-crust British cachet.
abstract: Tony Gilroy, managing director of Land Rover, helped save the company in the mid-1980s by realizing there was an affluent segment at the top of the SUV market that would respond to upper-crust British cachet; Range Rover North America was established in 1986 in response to this opportunity.
lead_paragraph: Tony Gilroy helped save Range Rover by realizing there was an affluent segment at the top of the new S.U.V. market that would respond to upper-crust British cachet.
